It is supposed to give a black background, although sometimes it incorrectly shows that background as white. Reproducible: Sometimes Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create an account at http://games.swirve.com/utopia/newacct.htm 2. Log in 3. When logged in, browse around on your pages. Sometimes you'll se the background as white instead of black Actual Results: The background became white about 1/10 of the times I look at the page Expected Results: It should have given a black background.

It is supposed to give a black background, although sometimes it incorrectly shows that background as white. Reproducible: Sometimes Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create an account at http://games.swirve.com/utopia/newacct.htm 2. Log in 3. When logged in, browse around on your pages. Sometimes you'll se the background as white instead of black Actual Results: The background became white about 1/10 of the times I look at the page Expected Results: It should have given a black background.

comments.author: waynegwoods@icloud.com
comments.text:
Hi Daniel,

I couldn't reproduce the problem using the code you wrote out in your bug
report, no matter how many times I reloaded it.

Are you using any browser themes, other than the default Firefox one that comes
with the browser? Or any browser extensions? If so, could you please try it
again after disabling them?

Also, backgrounds have been worked on in recent days, so you might try
downloading a recent nightly build from http://www.mozilla.org/developer/ and
seeing if that fixes it.

Please let us know how you go!

Also, just in case you try to reply to this bug by email, just a warning that it
won't go through. And there's currently a bug in the daemon that prevents it
bouncing your mail to alert you to that.
comments.raw_text:
Hi Daniel,

I couldn't reproduce the problem using the code you wrote out in your bug
report, no matter how many times I reloaded it.

Are you using any browser themes, other than the default Firefox one that comes
with the browser? Or any browser extensions? If so, could you please try it
again after disabling them?

Also, backgrounds have been worked on in recent days, so you might try
downloading a recent nightly build from http://www.mozilla.org/developer/ and
seeing if that fixes it.

Please let us know how you go!

Also, just in case you try to reply to this bug by email, just a warning that it
won't go through. And there's currently a bug in the daemon that prevents it
bouncing your mail to alert you to that.

comments.author: gibby_87@hotmail.com
comments.raw_text:
I and fixed the problem now, by trying Wayne's tip. The nightly build worked
like a charm, the version was 2004-03-11.

Bug resolved partially, since we do not know exactly what caused it, but I set
it to resolved anyway.
